results.title: Hanussen
results.creator_credit: Istvan Szabo, Arthur Brauner, Hungarofilm, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen, CCC Filmkunst and Objektiv Filmstudio Vallalat
results.brief_description: Hanussen is the third in a sumptuous film trilogy by Istvan Szabo, concerning Central Europe between the fall of the Austro-Hungarian Empire and the prelude to WWII. All three star the charismatic Austrian actor Klaus Maria Brandauer as individuals in whom the tragic contradictions of the period are brought to a crisis. In Hanussen he is an Austrian corporal wounded in the head during WWI, who then finds he has the power to foresee the rise of Nazism, but trivialises his powers as a hypnotist until his final downfall. Nominated for an Academy Award as best foreign film.

results.title: Gas! or It became necessary to destroy the world in order to save it
results.creator_credit: Roger Corman and San Jacinto Productions
results.brief_description: When the military authorities release a noxious substance that causes “death from instant old age” in everyone over twenty-five, the youth of America are left to their own devices to invent a new world order. This black, totally zany film is one of Roger Corman’s triumphs as it captures a blend of acid rock, far-out humour and revolutionary politicking in the true spirit of the sixties and the Love Generation. Stars Robert Corff, Elaine Giftos, Ben Vereen and Cindy Williams and features music performed by Country Joe and the Fish.

results.title: The Lower depths
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: Maxim Gorky’s ‘The Lower depths’ attracted two of cinema’s greatest practitioners to its pages. Just as Jean Renoir’s ‘Les Bas Fonds’ was a very French adaptation, so Kurosawa’s film is quite specifically Japanese, with Gorky’s Moscow slums transposing easily (and faithfully) to Kurosawa’s stylised Tokyo hovel. The resulting ensemble piece displays the director’s technical virtuosity and his ability to draw outstanding performances from his cast. Stars Toshiro Mifune. From the play by Maxim Gorky. Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Madonna of the seven moons
results.creator_credit: Arthur Crabtree, R.J. Minney and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Maddalena is a rich and respectable wife and mother, who occasionally abandons her Roman villa to go and live in Florence as Rosanna, the mistress of a handsome gipsy criminal. Like the classic horror film it is a drama rooted in sexual repression, using schizophrenia and amnesia rather than the fantastic. “Madonna of the Seven Moons” is based on the novel “The Madonna of Seven Moons” by Margery Lawrence and stars Stewart Granger, Phyllis Calvert and Patricia Roc.

results.title: King Solomon's mines
results.creator_credit: Andrew Marton, Compton Bennett, Sam Zimbalist, United Artists Corporation and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Perhaps no film in history has ever captured the languid and treacherous beauty of the jungle as has this shot on location spectacular based on H. Rider Haggard’s colossal tale. Stewart Granger, Deborah Kerr and Richard Carlson are thoroughly convincing as three adventurers on a perilous quest in the wilds of darkest Africa. At her beguiling best, Deborah Kerr plays a prim English lady whose husband has vanished into the jungle while searching for the legendary mines of King Solomon. Stewart Granger’s portrayal of Allan Quartermain, “white hunter” and reluctant leader of the danger fraught expedition, is one of the finest roles of his swashbuckling career. “King Solomon’s Mines” offers a colourful palette of action, danger, suspense, drama and romance. Particularly exciting are the extraordinary animal stampedes captured by Robert Sutees’ Oscar winning cinematography.

results.title: Murder most foul
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, Ben Arbeid and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel “Mrs. McGinty’s Dead” by Agatha Christie. Juror Miss Marple refuses to return a guilty verdict and initiates her own murder investigation backstage at a third-rate repertory company. A village baffler brimming with red herrings and tangled motives. Starring Margaret Rutherford and Ron Moody.

results.title: Little Lord Fauntleroy
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell and David O. Selznick
results.brief_description: Cedric is a spoilt child brought up in Brooklyn in the 1880’s who inherits an English title and finds his life transformed. In his stately family home in England, Cedric wins over his stern grandfather (C. Aubrey Smith). Freddie Bartholomew stars in the title role and is well supported by Dolores Costello as his mother and Mickey Rooney as the bootblack.

results.title: The Princess bride (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Andrew Scheinman and ACT III Communications
results.brief_description: A young boy (Fred Savage), bedridden with the flu, is less than thrilled when his grandfather (Peter Falk) arrives to read aloud the book “The Princess bride”. The story, set in the fairyland kingdom of Florin, recounts the adventures of Buttercup (Robin Wright), the most beautiful woman in the world, and Westley (Cary Elwes), the man she loves. The grandfather promises fencing, chases, escapes, love and miracles. His grandson soon discovers that his adventure story delivers much more. Appearances by Billy Crystal, Carol Kane, Mel Smith and more. Music by Mark Knopfler. Based upon the story by William Goldman.

results.title: Mermaids (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Richard Benjamin, Patrick Palmer, Wallis Nicita, Lauren Lloyd, Palmer and Nicita/Lloyd Productions
results.brief_description: Winona Ryder plays a strict Catholic schoolgirl growing up in the conservative early sixties and saddled with the grooviest and sexiest mother in town. A very funny romantic comedy, “Mermaids” celebrates the tensions, love and agonies of mother-daughter relationships. With Bob Hoskins and featuring an outstanding performance by Cher as the free-spirited mother of a very unconventional family. Based on the book by Patty Dann.

results.title: The Song of Bernadette
results.creator_credit: Henry King, William Perlberg and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A superb cast, including Vincent Price and Jennifer Jones triumph in this Academy Award winning film that tells the story of Bernadette Soubirous, the poverty-stricken, pure-hearted adolescent who saw a vision of a “Beautiful Lady” near her home town of Lourdes in 1858. The wondrous news spreads rapidly throughout France, leaving in its wake a variety of consequences. This true story, told with profound sincerity, sensitivity and reverence is both first rate filmmaking and an inspiring tribute to faith, personal courage and the glory of the human spirit.
